keyPolicies.policyTitle: An NHS free at the point of delivery
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour and Tories are accused of lying about UKIP and the NHS. UKIP promises to give £3 billion extra to the NHS to keep it free.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: No tax on the minimum wage
keyPolicies.policyDescription: UKIP believes that the poorest workers should not pay income tax at all.
UKIP aims to create social and low-cost housing on existing sites and help local youngsters get on the housing ladder.
UKIP wants to invest in affordable energy from shale gas and nuclear power, and criticizes the over-subsidization of solar farms.

issues.brexitEurope: UKIP opposes unlimited immigration, the 'free movement of labor' from the EU, which they associate with lower wages, and the £55 million a day membership fees. They want Britain to make its own trade with the rest of the world.
issues.governance: UKIP wants fairer, simpler tax and welfare systems, and rejects the 'bedroom tax' and 'mansion tax.'
issues.health: UKIP promises an additional £3 billion to the NHS and no charge more than £120 a year to see your GP.
issues.immigration: UKIP wants to control immigration to protect jobs for our children.
issues.socialWelfare: UKIP rejects the 'bedroom tax' and 'mansion tax' and calls for fairer welfare systems.

housing.content: UKIP expresses the need for prioritizing local people in housing, with a focus on social and low-cost housing on existing sites to aid local youngsters.

contactInformation.address: Lexdrum House, King Charles Business Park, Newton Abbot TQ12 6UT

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet details UKIP's stance on multiple key issues and emphasizes their opposition to policies of Labour and the Tories.
